summary: This bill, the African Burial Ground International Memorial Museum and Educational Center Act, proposes the establishment of a museum and educational center at the African Burial Ground National Monument in New York City. The museum would serve as a permanent memorial, explore the history of slavery, and encourage collaboration with other institutions. The Secretary of the Interior, in consultation with an advisory council, would oversee the museum's operation, site acquisition, and construction. The bill also outlines funding authorization and purposes for the museum.
